root.title: Old Turkic writing on a bronze mirror found in Irtysh
root.names: "Runic writing on Irtysh bronze mirror", "The Irtysh Runic Samples"
root.place: The mirror was found in an old Turkic barrow ("the 146th barrow") near the village "Zevakino Shemonaihinsk" on coast of Irtysh river of East Kazakhstan oblast. Remains of a woman and some subjects were found in the barrow.
root.store: The mirror is stored in the local history museum of East Kazakhstan oblast (?).
root.general: Қола айнаның жиегi мен iшкі шеңберінде дөңгелене үшкiр темiр затпен қашалып 2 жол мәтін жазылған.
root.description: 2 lines of the writing are carved round by sharp iron subject on edge and on an internal circle of the bronze mirror. There are 20 signs in the first line and 11 signs in the second line.
root.size: Height of symbols is 1.2-1.5 cm. The length of circle of the mirror is 10 cm. The thickness of the mirror is 1 cm.
root.investigation: F.H.Arslanova found in 1969. F.H.Arslanova, S.G.Kljashtornyi 468, A.S.Amanzholov 399 conducted researches of the writing.
root.details: Н.Базылхан "Көне түрік бітіктастары мен ескерткіштері (Орхон, Ениесей, Талас)" //"Қазақстан тарихы түркі тілді деректемелерде" атты сериясы бойынша. II том. - Алматы: Дайк-пресс, 2005. - Б.241.
